info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 2:04PM CDT until July 30 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest Indiana, including the following counties, Jasper, Lake IN, Newton and Porter.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 201 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and locally 4 inches of rain have fallen. The highest totals have been near the Kankakee River. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Valparaiso, Crown Point, Cedar Lake, Lowell, DeMotte, Hebron, Wheatfield, Lake Village, Lakes of the Four Seasons, Winfield, Roselawn, Kouts, Lake Dalecarlia, Shelby, Schneider, Stoutsburg, Thayer, Fair Oaks, Boone Grove and Parr. - A Flash Flood Warning is in effect until 6 PM CDT for areas near the Kankakee River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Jasper, IN; Lake, IN; Newton, IN; Porter, IN
